title: @Riot is there more lore on Arclight Yorick or the Arclight theme in general?
body: I'm currently writing a script for  a voice over for Yorick's skin and it'd be awesome if someone on skins team could fill me in on any lore or tidbits about Arclight and Yorick's part in the universe. I read on the PBE board that he was a king that lost his wife which is a good story thread but if there's any more information it would help a ton! Maybe Kindlejack or someone who worked on the skin could help?

replies.body:
Hey Nintendo625! +1 to Kindlejack's info about Vel'Koz and his hefty contribution to the Arclight thematic lore. The way we try to approach skins nowadays is to fully flesh out what X champ's story is within a given thematic, with the intent to let that then inform design throughout the entirety of the skin from Concept all the way through to VFX and SFX. Ideally we treat the story as sort of a creative North Star. So we started there.

In this thematic, Yorick is essentially a king of a great and prosperous land, and when darkness descends upon his kingdom he is tested by the divine light of VelKoz's gaze. Passing the trial, he gains power and dominion over light, becoming a paladin of the Arclight Order to protect the mortal realm from the dark threat. In doing this, however, he also loses his mortality. Yorick outlives his beloved queen, his children, grandchildren, his kingdom and it's people. In taking on the light he ends up still losing the very thing he vowed to protect with it's powers. The last remaining humanity left in him uses the light to create constructs, monuments to his fallen queen. For flavor, I imagined that the collective vision of the Arclight would skew time, pulling you back out of your linear mortal view of it and replacing it with a harsh birds eye view of everything before and after. The overall idea is that while we were going for a 180 degree turn for the aesthetic of the skin, the story would still be tragic and dramatic.

I appreciate you reading this far, would love to read whatever you come up with. I used to create stories around existing skin thematics and new ideas for skins for hours as a player, and literally never tire of seeing and reading player created content. GG amigo!

Are players supposed to "get" this? Because none of that comes through in game or in client and to me makes Arclight one of the most boring and generic skin themes available - just toss in some golden light particles and done.

Well, we use the story internally to have something cohesive to lean on throughout the production of the skin. If you think about the way the majority of players experience a new skin, it's actually not as soon as it hits PBE all over the boards, Reddit, surrender@20 etc. A lot of the story, as Chromatic Eagle rightly pointed out below, is told through the splash as the first point of story context, within the client. With Yorick we had a lot of real estate to tell some of the story within the game engine with all of his spells, minions and maiden as well. If that's not resonating for you, to be honest, that sucks to hear. I mean with such a large player base there's literally no way to please everyone, especially under the pressure of the "6 year wait" for a new Yorick skin. We knew that going in, but please know that this was anything but a "kill the memes" attempt. We all view Yorick as an incredibly underrated champion, both from gameplay and creative perspectives, and my team was absolutely foaming at the mouth to work on him. We have ton of ideas for more skins for him, as we all had a blast working on him and plan on revisiting him on a regular skin cadence. Thanks for the feedback, check out the splash when it arrives!

I'm trying to be nice and remember that I'm speaking to a person,  but can you see/ understand why some of us think that Arclight Yorick is just  a "kill the memes," minimalistic effort from the company? 

Sion got a legendary skin after his rework.

Taric got the Pool Party skin 10 weeks after his rework. 

Fiora got a PROJECT skin after hers.

Poppy got a Star Guardian skin after hers.

All of them high quality skins with loads of fanfare and promotion

But, after six years of pain and suffering for this fan (including hate from Rioters in person at conventions ans at Riot HQ), Yorick gets this skin. Something that looks average at best (A testament to the increase in quality) and really needs a new VO to make sense. It's also hidden behind 4 other skins this patch, including Master Yi's 20th. 

Also, no one on the team was around when Yorick was launched, and no one on the team plays with Yorick, as far as I can tell. Carlos also admitted on the PBE that there was no thought given to the six year wait.

So, from my perspective, this was just a "take it of the checklist" effort from the team who can, and has, done better for other neglected champs (Blood Moon not withstanding).

I know it's probably going to come off as way too mean, but that's how I really feel about this. 

Thanks for reading.

I just mean that at some point players are going to put together how rewarding and fun he is to play (split push, like, all lanes GG) and it'll be crazytown.

Hey man if you need ideas for a Yorick skin, I pitched this to Katey in another thread but Pool Party Yorick, or just an aquatic theme in general. Think about it Sandcastle Cage, Giant Toy Shovel, Coral reef as his back piece, and the piece de resistance: A MERMAID MAIDEN, MERMAIDEN!!! My only complaint is that the pool party skins have already had so many contributions. I'm not sure if the theme would still work as Atlantean/Deep Sea. Maybe you could call it Beach Bro Yorick. As an aside I like the skin you guys did a great job and I'll definitely buy it day 1. I'm wondering if there is anywhere I can read about the alternate universe skin lines. I know the new Star Guardians is the first time the lore team went full out on a skin line. I think it'd be awesome to read about the thought process the skins teams go through when coming up with new designs or revisiting older ones. I'd love to read a dev blog about the Arclight/Elderwood/Project skin lines and why certain champions are chosen over others. What the champions connections are in those universes etc. I quoted you but this goes Riot Kindlejack and the whole team.

Hahaha yeah dude.... I want Pool Party 'Ricky like you wouldn't believe! Someone posted a doooooope concept of it on reddit where it was clearly drawn in mspaint or something, but the CONTENT of what was there was perfect. Mermaid-en (bless me Phreak) has to happen if we get to do that skin, damn I love that idea!

As far as the stories we put into our skins, we haven't really published a lot of that stuff. A post about interesting internal lore tidbits might be a interesting. I know when I arrived I basically sat with Kindlejack and just asked him all about everything I've ever wanted to know about skins, where certain ones came from, and what the internal lore is, etc. My guess is you'll probably be seeing an increasing amount of that kind of stuff shared out over time, as we've put a lot of effort into these alternate universes. We're all absolute geeks who nerd out over these elseworld representations of the champs we love and are super hyped that we're able to funnel that kind of love and craft into the content we put out, so it'd be really cool to share some of that stuff in a broader way. Until then, hit up Kindlejack-the-all-knowing. Or ping me and I can poke his desk with a banana ;)

I'm not saying that every skin line needs the same hype as the Star Guardian page, or a cinematic like Project, but a comic or webpage going a little more in depth can be appreciated. Think Pentakill.

Oh dude, I used to work in comics. I'd have us do comics for every skin release if I could. Part of delivering high quality content every two weeks to you guys is that we have to budget our time and resources appropriately. To date, comics and microsites for every skin/patch isn't the norm, but who knows where we could go in the future. We used to do champion updates and leave the existing Splash Art in the client, but now we redo them as part of that package!

I concepted Pentakill Kayle, and the creative rush of seeing that whole thing come together with the album, the player created art, the microsite, the insane cinematic... it was incredible. I'd love to be able to do that level of content more!

I like the comics that you've been doing that focus on the canon lore of the game, I'm afraid if you guys focus on skins that just means less lore and comics that tells the story of runeterra. Sure would be cool if you guys could get some big name artist for a one shot comic though like frank quitely or something 😯

To be honest as well - that Riot thought Arclight Yorick was the best new skin that could be made for him sucks to hear and see as a Yorick player.

I look at the splash and see basically what I would call Paladin Yorick. The art is good from a technical perspective but the subject matter remains a generic and cliche theme.
Sometimes a splash art tells a story.

GIMME.

Have you figured something out about where Justicar skins fit in the thematic? Are they in the same world, or a different setting from Arclight? 

Also related, would you ever decide to rename old skins to align them with modern, more fleshed out skins, for example renaming Justicar > Arclight?

I've talked a bit about Justicar on the [boards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/QTalv8EF-kindlejack-in-regards-to-dreadnova-twitch?comment=00050003000000000000000000020000000000000000) in the past. Players here have pointed out some really cool differences that could potentially identify the themes in the future:
- Arclight is about religion while Justicar is about heroes
- Justicar specifically is evil characters turned good, while Arclight is primarily dark characters turned light.
- Arclight has a paladin, holy order sort of vibe and is visually cohesive. Aatrox and Syndra's designs are quite different from each other, a little more wild.

I had an idea years ago to revisit Justicar and really figure it out, but now I'm on champion so we'll see if skins ever take a crack at it :)

When it comes to renaming old skins we've discussed it in the past and for now at least decided to leave the old names alone. While it might add some value for cohesion and theming it feels like it would just be disruptive and unnecessary for the majority of players. This might change in the future though - we renamed one of the Ryze skins when he was reworked for example.

Arclight Vel'koz probably introduced the most lore; where he is *the* god that bestows the power of arclight upon mortals in times of darkness. His splash depicts him manifesting before a church to 'test' warriors hoping to become his chosen archangels. Those found worthy will become arclight, and spend eternity doing his bidding in the mortal realm. Those not worthy, well, disintegration and oblivion await. Varus and Vayne were found worthy and granted righteous power and immortality.

Rioit DrPh8 would know the full story for Yorick as he worked on his concept with Aleks Nikonov, but I know that a King made arclight would eventually have to watch his queen, his family and even his kingdom fade to nothing as the ages wheel. I wonder what Vel'koz would make of his fixated worship of his lost love, is it divine or blasphemy?

I haven't heard of a general lore for the Arclight theme, but we know a bit about each individual skin thanks to their release post:
Varus: This alternate look for Varus emanates bright power. Rediscover the Ionian warrior just after he embraces the corruption he once guarded, but before the darkness consumes him. New animations and spell effects shine fresh light on the Arrow of Retribution, and you'll hear an uncorrupted treatment of his voice.
Vel'Koz: One eye, piercingly blue, coolly stares from behind Arclight armor. A man cowers before it. All the light in the cavernous hall suddenly rushes toward the unblinking eye, refracting off its cornea and generating enormous, purifying power. The man’s body lifts from the stone beneath his feet. His skin blisters before his body disappears in the blinding light.
Vayne: A pair of golden wings speed her through the air as she slings bolts of light from a heavenly crossbow, smiting the fools who question her supremacy. True warriors dream of testing their skills against her divine power.
The lucky ones wake up before they do.

I think this is all we got about the Arclight theme. And there is the theory, that Vel'Koz transforms people into the Arclight warriors (so the man in his story gets transformed and not killed).
So maybe Yoricks release post will bring some lore for his skin.
